trg_text: Update on the Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) In his address to the nation on Wednesday, 16 September 2020, President Cyril Ramaphosa announced the move to Alert Level 1 of the national lockdown with effect from Monday, 21 September 2020.

trg_text: Based on data obtained through the South African Police Service (SAPS), government has sadly identified 30 GBVF hotspots around the countr Cabinet has assured the affected communities that working with the police, intervention measures will be strengthened to ensure the protection and safety of women and childreCabinet has welcomed and appreciated the R50-million donation from the United Kingdom which will extend the Solidarity Fund s ongoing efforts to counter the economic devastation caused by the COVID-19 pandemi The funds will focus on projects that support and promote womeCabinet also expressed concern at disturbing reports of human-trafficking incidences involving women and children in the countr Police are following up and investigating all reported cases related to human and drug traffickinCabinet appeals to the public to report these heinous crimes to the police immediately instead of using social media platforms, which makes it difficult for law-enforcement agencies to respond quickly and adequatel The public is again cautioned to refrain from peddling fake news, which may cause unnecessary panic, inflame emotions and incite violence in our societAnyone with information should contact the SAPS on the Crime Stop number 08600 10111 or use the free MySAPS Application, which can be downloaded on any iPhone or smartphone Destruction and theft of public infrastructureCabinet welcomes the recent arrests of suspects in Johannesburg and Cape Town involved in stealing copper cables and train signal cable Police also acted swiftly in arresting people involved in the destruction of the main road in Msinga, KwaZulu-Nata Cabinet commends this breakthrough made by the police on the theft and vandalizing of the rail infrastructure; a serious crime which resulted in some instances in the loss of innocent lives due to train collusion Public infrastructure remains the cornerstone of driving our econom It remains a critical component in our drive to grow the economy and create the much-needed job Cabinet calls on all South Africans to report these criminal activities to the policeSouth African Social Security Agency (SASSA) online serviceCabinet welcomed the launch of the online grant application portal by the SASSA, which enables applications to be lodged on https://servicesassgoz The portal

trg_text: Correctional Services Amendment Bill of 2020Cabinet approved the submission of the Correctional Services Amendment Bill of 2020 to Parliamen The amendments are primarily in response to the Constitutional Court judgement handed down in the Phaahla Judgement on 3 May 2019.The amendments entrench the right to a fair trial as contemplated in Section 35(3)(n) of the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa of 1996 in the application of the Section 136 (1) of the Correctional Services Act, 1998 (Act 111 of 1998) SAPS Amendment Bill of 2020Cabinet approved publication of the Bill in the Government Gazette for public comment The Bill amends the SAPS Act, 1995 (Act 68 of 1995), to bring it in line with the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa of 1996 and to ensure optimal policin
